As some of you have already noticed, I have released the code of a 
TestRunner I have been working on for quite some time.  The main 
features of this runner are:

- custom listeners
- resources (like a connection to a database) shared by tests
- properties split for the runner and tests
- custom monitor (to manage the execution of the tests)

This runner is very flexible (IMO) and was designed especially for 
integration tests.  You can download it from the JUnit-addons website.

<http://sf.net/projects/junit-addons>

The (very short) documentation is available at:

<http://www.worldwidewiki.net/wiki/JunitAddonsRunner>

and of course there's the code.  If you think that the documentation is 
not enough, you're free to contribute to it.  Please note that the 
software is released AS IS:  I won't answer to private emails unless you 
have attached some patch.

If you're ready to try someting risky, here's the ouput of a run:
